content.prompt: The data in Table 2 most strongly suggest that

choices.label: democratic governments were more successful in delivering economic prosperity to their citizens than nondemocratic governments were
central planning failed to stimulate economic growth in countries where it was used
extensive welfare benefits were a drag on economic performance in both Eastern and Western Europe
countries that were part of multilateral military alliances, such as NATO and the Warsaw Pact, tended to perform better economically

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
